report_title: Industry at a Glance: Plastics Wholesaling in the US
executive_summary: As a key supply chain intermediary, plastics wholesalers distribute resin and raw plastic materials to plastic product manufacturers, other wholesalers, businesses, retailers and many other buyers. The industry has historically been vulnerable to economic fluctuations that disrupt its upstream suppliers and downstream buyers, as demonstrated during the pandemic and the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Plastics wholesalers are subject to price changes in plastic materials and resin, contributing to considerable revenue volatility in recent years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consolidation has increased as mid-sized wholesalers out-price smaller competitors and capture more lucrative direct-distribution contracts. Successful wholesalers will target competitors operating in new markets and locations. Since wholesalers compete on price and reputation, growing companies can effectively expand economies of scale, offering a competitive pricing model while maintaining a high profit margin.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Suppliers and Wholesalers Shift Corporate Focus
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Volatile input costs and revenue have forced many plastic manufacturers and distributors to alter business strategies. Notably, manufacturers are streamlining relationships with distributors, relying on a single wholesaler to sell their products to potential buyers. These arrangements enable wholesalers to guarantee multiyear supply contracts and become the only distributor carrying that manufacturer's product line. Wholesalers can also provide better customer service and order size flexibility than manufacturers selling directly to customers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Input Prices Have Grown Volatile During the Period
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Volatility in the price of plastic materials and resin has widespread implications for plastic manufacturers, influencing the price at which wholesalers purchase these intermediate parts to supply to their downstream markets. Since wholesalers can't immediately reflect these changes in their pricing model or through contracts, maintaining consistent revenue proves difficult.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As consumer preferences shift toward environmentally friendly alternatives, wholesalers have rebranded to focus on recycling, sustainability and combating climate change. Paper and metal straw alternatives have grown popular in consumer segments, displacing plastic straws. Similarly, many states and municipalities have banned plastic bags. Wholesalers will rely on innovation from plastic and resin manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Major Markets Struggle to Cope With Rising Interest Rates
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US Federal Reserve will continue its quantitative tightening to fight inflation during the outlook period. Funding new projects, like office buildings, homes or manufacturing plants, will continue to grow more expensive. Contractors often purchase large quantities of plastic piping and tubes. Car manufacturers also heavily use resins and other plastics. As interest rates mount, auto loans will become more expensive, limiting demand for new car sales.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Contracting Oil Prices Will Provide Some Relief
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Oil price volatility will persist, although the world price of crude oil is expected to lag over the next five years despite year-over-year volatility. A contraction in the world price of crude oil will make plastic production less expensive, placing downward pressure on selling prices. This will threaten growth but cut purchasing costs. This trend will also enable profit to stabilize after declining during the current period.

industry_definition: This industry wholesales plastic materials and resins, as well as unsupported plastic films, sheeting, rods, tubes and other basic forms and shapes. The industry predominantly sells these products to industrial manufacturers. Manufacturers use plastic products to manufacture durable goods.
key_trends: Wholesalers have turned to consolidation to stimulate growth. Larger wholesalers have leveraged economies of scale and existing relationships to outperform smaller companies and target niche acquisitions.
Wholesalers will rely on the recovery of downstream markets. Rising interest rates and consumer preferences turning away from plastic products will constrain growth.
The industry faces light regulation. Wholesalers must acquire standard wholesaler licenses and abide by transportation and waste laws.
Plastics wholesalers benefit from industry associations. Tariffs also protect wholesalers from competing with foreign manufacturers and distributors.
Downstream markets are critical to wholesalers. Other wholesalers, manufacturing industries and the construction sector purchase significant plastic and resin products.
The industry sells a wide variety of plastic products. The varied nature enables wholesalers to weather downturns in specific markets by transitioning to more profitable areas.

To cut transportation costs, wholesalers position themselves near major trading hubs and supply chains. Wholesalers will frequently locate in the Great Lakes and Southeast since many plastic manufacturers are in these regions.
Long-term distribution agreements are crucial to a plastic wholesaler's success. This impacts a wholesaler's ability to meet customer needs and limit cost fluctuations.

Price and service are key components of success for wholesalers. Strong reputations will enable wholesalers to secure more contracts. Companies have looked to consolidate to increase economies of scale. Even so, no company in the industry controls a significant share of total sales.
The highly fragmented nature of the industry limits scale. Wholesalers serve a variety of niche and mainstream markets and offer a massive variety of products across the economy.
Wholesalers have attempted to lower wage costs by integrating new technology. Still, wholesalers need labor for nearly all vital services, like packing, sales and transportation.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Industrial manufacturers use resins and other primary forms of plastics to make a wide variety of products that serve many diversified industries. In addition to being a key input for manufactured goods, plastic is also a key input in packaging materials used to ship and display those goods, like plastic wrap, foam and mailers.

Plastics wholesaling is a highly fragmented industry; individual distributors don't always have the scope to reach all available markets. Several wholesalers sell plastic products to other wholesalers with established distribution networks in different markets. This market's share of industry revenue will weaken over the outlook period as wholesale bypass continues and more wholesalers exit the industry. The growth of e-commerce has connected manufacturers to end users, hastening this trend.

Plastics used in construction primarily include thermoplastic resins, plastic piping and plastic laminates. Activity in the construction of new residential homes, nonresidential construction and infrastructure projects drives this market. This market has strong product diversity, sheltering it from large shifts. Even so, rising interest rates have reduced construction activity, causing this market to shrink.

Sales to exporters make up a significant portion of revenue in this segment, even if the industry doesn't actively engage in trade markets. This segment also includes sales to government bodies, restaurants, hotels and households. This market segment plummeted in 2020 as consumers conducted more online business and cut out nonessential goods. As consumer spending rebounds from 2020 declines, demand from this segment will recover.

Businesses purchase plastic products, including plastic wrap, packing material and foam products for packaging and storage. Business users also buy plastic components at the wholesale level for use in their own final goods.
Retailers and repair shops demand various plastic products to sell to consumers as part of a finished product or as a replacement piece for a previously purchased item.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Raw Plastic Materials and Laminates Face Eco-Friendly Alternatives
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers and businesses will swap traditional plastic items for eco-friendly alternatives as they become more environmentally conscious. Polypropylene plastics, though, will push back on eco-friendly options.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PLASTIC PIPES, RODS, TUBES AND SHAPES RELY ON THE CONSTRUCTION SECTOR
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Wholesalers often purchase these parts to provide to their end markets as intermediate goods for production. There are three main types of plastic pipes: solid wall pipes, structured wall pipes and barrier pipes. These are often made from cross-linked polyethylene (PEX) pipes or polyvinyl chloride (PVC) pipes, depending on the desired level of flexibility and longevity.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PLASTIC PACKING, PACKAGING MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES FACE HEAVY SUBSTITUTE COMPETITION
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment will increase as more businesses turn to e-commerce – a trend most widely adopted during the pandemic. Before the pandemic, strong growth in the personal care, pharmaceuticals and food and beverage sector supported growth for this segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: SYNTHETIC RESINS ARE CRITICAL TO THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Synthetic resins are artificially synthesized polymers and act as the basic material of plastics. Resins are divided into thermoplastic and thermosetting resins, describing whether the material will change shape when exposed to heat.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Miscellaneous Chemicals and Other Plastics Make Up the Largest Product Segment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Cascading effects from supply chain disruptions have made it difficult for manufacturers to source resins, depressing this product line.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region has a plethora of downstream manufacturing buyers. Establishments in this region take advantage of the established plastic supply chain to sell to various downstream manufacturers easily. The Great Lakes region has easy access to Canada, which encourages international trade in the region.

MOST WHOLESALERS LOCATE IN THE SOUTHEAST REGION. This region is the most populous in the United States, explaining the industry's large presence. The Southeast region provides lax regulations and abundant, inexpensive labor. Wholesalers in this region also benefit from proximity to major manufacturers and downstream retailers.

THE WEST REGION IS CRITICAL FOR INTERNATIONAL TRADE. As a result of its large population and presence as an industrial hub, California is home to the highest portion of industry establishments in the United States. California is also home to the country's largest ports, encouraging trade with Asia and neighboring countries.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Plastic wholesalers follow standard wholesaling regulations and must obtain reseller licenses to sell goods without sales tax. Companies are subject to federal, state and local laws, though exact wholesaler license requirements typically differ by state. These regulations govern the use, labeling, packaging and transportation of chemicals and hazardous substances.

Wholesalers must comply with environmental safety laws concerning the handling, storage, transportation, treatment and disposal of different waste materials. The Federal Hazardous Materials Transportation Law (FHMTL) and the Hazardous Materials Regulations (HMR) are examples of regulations.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the decline stage of its life cycle.
The level of industry assistance is low and steady.

factors_increased_barrier: The industry is in the decline stage of its life cycle.
factors_decreased_barrier: The revenue volatility level is low.
The capital intensity level is low.
Despite technological innovation, wholesalers rely on labor for most activities like sales, transportation, packing and storing.

basis_points.basis_description: Long-term distribution agreements are crucial to a plastic wholesaler's success. This impacts a wholesaler's ability to meet customer needs and limit cost fluctuations.
Price and service are key components of success for wholesalers. Strong reputations will enable wholesalers to secure more contracts.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top two companies in the Plastics Wholesaling industry account for less than 5.0% of total revenue in 2024.
Even so, large wholesalers leverage strong reputations, international presences and favorable contracts to maintain advantages over smaller counterparts.
There have been several mergers and acquisitions among the larger wholesalers, particularly within the blow molding segment.
This industry's localized nature of most businesses and widely diversified product mix also contribute to the industry's highly fragmented nature.
The extensive range of end-user product needs and the many kinds of plastics available enable smaller companies to compete within particular niche markets.
The niche market for plastics with a lower environmental impact will generate steady demand through 2024 to serve the expanding number of environmentally conscious consumers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Supply Chain Disruptions Add to Purchasing Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The graph shows the percentage of revenue spent on purchases from 2005 to 2024 (projected). The percentage has increased steadily from around 60% in 2005 to over 80% in the projected year 2024.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Crude oil is essential in plastic production
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Sanctions on Russian oil have thrown the industry's supply chain into chaos. Many wholesalers, though, leverage supply contracts, limiting purchase cost volatility.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES CLIMB DESPITE THE PANDEMIC SLOWDOWN
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have grown while revenue has declined, contributing to rising wage costs as a share of revenue over the past five years. Many wholesalers have replaced low-wage workers with a few higher-skilled employees who manage automated systems and command greater pay.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: SMALL COMPANIES STRUGGLE TO MAINTAIN PROFIT
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Large companies leverage existing contracts and strong relationships to maintain sales and low supply costs. This trend was especially prevalent during the pandemic, preventing small wholesalers from growing profits.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Despite technological innovation, wholesalers rely on labor for most activities like sales, transportation, packing and storing.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The concentration of technologies is high in this industry
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The concentration of technologies is high in this industry.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Supply chain disruptions have led to volatile plastic prices.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE PANDEMIC CAUSED UNCERTAINTY IN THE INDUSTRY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Downstream markets grew inflammatory during the pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: RAW PLASTIC MATERIALS AND LAMINATES FACE ECO-FRIENDLY ALTERNATIVES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Raw plastics and other plastic materials include polyethylene terephthalate, high-density polyethylene vinyl and polyvinyl chloride.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: SYNTHETIC RESINS ARE CRITICAL TO THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Synthetic resins are artificially synthesized polymers and act as the basic material of plastics.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: The larger wholesalers provide a diversified range of products, whereas the smaller companies tend to provide niche products.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Plastic is a material involved in many aspects of society.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in locations with well-establish infrastructure networks?
FAQs.answer: Some wholesalers have expanded into international markets through acquisitions and joint ventures.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Crude oil and other chemicals are necessary raw materials for plastic manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: The price of oil constantly fluctuates, making it hard for wholesalers to properly maintain or increase profit.
